snippet: Inspired by the dabke, a popular Arabic dance, this production is more than a folk dance, both to its credit and its detriment.
abstract: Gia Kourlas reviews United States premiere of dance Badke, created in collaboration between Belgian dance company Les Ballets C de la B, theater company KVS and Palestinian cultural group AM Qattan Foundation; work is presented at New York Live Arts as part of Live Ideas festival.
lead_paragraph: Inspired by the dabke, a popular Arabic dance, this production is more than a folk dance, both to its credit and its detriment.

headline.main: Review: ‘Badke,’ a Contemporary Spin on an Arabic Folk Dance
headline.print_headline: Bursts of Energy and Styles to Match

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Les Ballets C de la B
